title: (x) Aria 3 by Cafe del Mar CD-cover
content:
Hi.

Did anyone know the font used on this cover?  
(including the word “Cafe del Mar”)  
Are that “R” custom made?

Thank’s

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [cover\_cafedelmararia3\_t.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080414010405/http:/typophile.com/files/cover_cafedelmararia3_t.jpg) | 21.39 KB |

 [‹ (x) Triple Crown Clothing - Boston Truck Style {Forrest}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080414010405/http:/typophile.com/node/17327 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Harper's Bazaar headline face - H&FJ Didot {Fredrik} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080414010405/http:/typophile.com/node/17321 "Go to next forum topic")
author: jrsilva

comments.content:
Small sample... “Metamorphosis” and “Created by Paul Schwartz” are set in [Goudy Old Style](http://web.archive.org/web/20080414010405/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/goudy/old-style/).

— [omine.net](http://web.archive.org/web/20080414010405/http:/www.omine.net/)
Thank’s Eduardo but I mean, “ARIA” and “Cafe del Mar”.
Aria looks like Adobe Garamond with a customized R.

OK. Could be.  
How about “Cafe del Mar”?

It is pretty hard to make out in the sample, sorry.

You could try the Script Font ID at bowfinprintworks - elaborate or ornate script :

[http://www.bowfinprintworks.com/Script13Pg1.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080414010405/http:/www.bowfinprintworks.com/Script13Pg1.html "http://www.bowfinprintworks.com/Script13Pg1.html")
